title: High Government Spending Relative to GDP
description: In 2022, Kiribati's government final consumption expenditure was 61.53% of GDP, indicating a significant portion of the economy is driven by government spending.

title: Extensive Final Consumption Expenditure
description: Kiribati's final consumption expenditure reached 162.39% of GDP in 2022, highlighting a high level of consumption relative to the country's economic output.

title: High Gross National Expenditure
description: In 2022, Kiribati's gross national expenditure was 182.69% of GDP, reflecting substantial spending within the economy.

title: Significant Investment in Education
description: Kiribati allocated 14.20% of its GDP to education in 2021, showcasing a strong commitment to educational development.

title: High Mortality Rate from Non-Communicable Diseases
description: In 2021, the mortality rate from CVD, cancer, diabetes, or CRD was 44.1% for ages 30-70, indicating a significant health challenge.

title: Elevated Male Mortality from Non-Communicable Diseases
description: The male mortality rate from CVD, cancer, diabetes, or CRD was 51.1% in 2021, highlighting a critical health issue among men.

title: High Female Mortality from Non-Communicable Diseases
description: In 2021, the female mortality rate from CVD, cancer, diabetes, or CRD was 37.8%, pointing to significant health concerns for women.

title: High Youth Unemployment and Inactivity
description: In 2020, 53.67% of Kiribati's youth were not in education, employment, or training, indicating a major challenge in youth engagement.

title: Significant Male Youth Unemployment and Inactivity
description: 51.58% of male youth in Kiribati were not in education, employment, or training in 2020, reflecting a critical issue in male youth development.

title: Minimal Methane Emissions from Transport
description: In 2023, Kiribati recorded one of the lowest methane emissions from transport, with a value of 0.0001 Mt CO2e, showcasing its minimal impact on global greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Low Personal Remittances Paid
description: In 2023, Kiribati's personal remittances paid amounted to $1,542,579.77, indicating a low outflow of funds to other countries.

title: Negative Net Incurrence of Liabilities
description: Kiribati had a net incurrence of liabilities at -3.04% of GDP in 2023, reflecting a reduction in overall liabilities.

title: Minimal New Business Registrations
description: In 2018, only 2 new businesses were registered in Kiribati, highlighting challenges in entrepreneurial growth.

title: Low Fixed Telephone Subscriptions
description: As of 2023, Kiribati had only 26 fixed telephone subscriptions, indicating limited telecommunication infrastructure.

title: Significant External Balance Deficit
description: In 2023, Kiribati's external balance on goods and services was -85.01% of GDP, indicating a substantial trade deficit.

title: Minimal Agricultural Raw Materials Exports
description: In 2021, agricultural raw materials made up only 0.0017% of Kiribati's merchandise exports, showing limited agricultural export activity.

title: Low Merchandise Exports to South Asia
description: In 2019, merchandise exports to South Asia accounted for a mere 0.00003% of Kiribati's total merchandise exports, indicating minimal trade relations with the region.

title: Minimal International Tourism Receipts
description: In 2020, Kiribati's international tourism receipts for travel items were $29,999.99, reflecting a small tourism sector.

title: Low Out-of-Pocket Expenditure Per Capita
description: In 2022, Kiribati's out-of-pocket expenditure per capita was $1.71, indicating low personal spending on health.
